Add your review Blogger reviews Bloggers, have you reviewed this restaurant? Add your review to this page. Diner reviews
Sort by: Relevance | Date | Positive | Negative
June 29, 2012 Likes it Speed and Service by ElJefe ( 4 reviews ) These employees are trained very well and get food to you super fast. It's kinda the Chick Fil A model but for Mexican food. I see lots of familiar faces behind the counter as well. They like working there! I love eating there! March 30, 2012 Likes it Fast and Cheap by Kris ( 8 reviews ) The first time that I had Rosa's I fell in love. I got my food so quickly and the prices are amazing... especially on Taco Tuesday. I do find, however, that they are inconsistent. It is a fast food place after all, and sometimes I go and get disappointed. Rosa's is by no mean restaurant quality food, but it is good fast tex-mex that satisfies my cravings for a good taco. October 12, 2011 Rosa's makes me see red by RedRaiderZ ( 45 reviews ) The parking here tends to be atrocious and you better be mindful of the people winding through the parking lot for to-go orders. It galls me a little that you stand in line, get your own drinks, condiments, silverware, etc. and are paying regular sit-down restaurant prices. That all said, their fajita meat is tender, mesquite grilled, and the taste is outstanding. To avoid feeling wallet raped, I take the family on"Taco Tuesdays"where you can get a 3 taco platter for about $3.50. This is a pretty good deal. However, it still irks me that I am paying meal prices for what amounts to a hybrid fast food restaurant. Good food, but a bit pricey for what it is. May 16, 2011 Doesn't like it This place has YOU figured out!! by Trust Me Food Critic ( 118 reviews ) I am still trying to figure out what the huge attraction is with this place? Yes it is very popular and busy all the time. lets break this down: Stand in line, pay regular sit down restaurant prices, get all your own drinks, condiments etc...try to find a place to sit, pick up your food at the counter...and eat what I think is kinda crummy Mexican food?! Yes my kids love it and I have to eat here at least once a week and yes it burns me every time I see how much I pay for 4. Geez. April 16, 2011 Likes it Good chain food by Purist ( 36 reviews ) We go to this location once a month. The food is consistantly good. We enjoy the fresh made tortillas. They do have a few cashiers up front who tend to get a bit impatient when they feel you aren't spitting out your order fast enough. We've taken family here to eat and they loved the fresh tortillas and the atmosphere. December 25, 2010 Really likes it Mobile review by J. M. Clark IV ( 26 reviews ) Will always be one if my favorite places to eat of all time!! September 12, 2010 Doesn't like it Mobile review by Ally15 ( 88 reviews ) Tortillas are the only saving grace. Otherwise it's like Taco Villa, only more expensive. I think the beer attracts some, too. May 2, 2010 Likes it It is what it is by Lost in Lubbock ( 37 reviews ) This is Lubbock's version of Taco Cabana. March 27, 2010 Likes it A Better Fast Food Option by KY Connection ( 337 reviews ) OK, OK, OK...not top notch mexican food, but it is better than going to McD's or BK. Tortilla's are really good. December 28, 2009 Likes it Fresh Tortillas by slcfoodie ( 51 reviews ) There is just no comparison to the fresh flour tortillas they make here. Especially dipped in their queso or honey. I come here just for the tortillas although they also have good tamales and chicken tacos. May 11, 2009 Mobile review by rebecca ( 43 reviews ) If I'm gonna do fast food I'll pick Rosa's over burger chains. The beef fajita plate is kind of a guilty pleasure. September 14, 2009 Mobile review by Colby Heatwole ( 1 review ) The most bland food in Lubbock. Everything tastes the same. Not a good plce to eat if you actually like tasting different flavors. 1 out of 1 found this review helpful August 10, 2009 Doesn't like it Mobile review by A. ( 14 reviews ) great tortillas but it stops there...the rest of the food is pretty sub par July 8, 2011 82nd Street location by Mary ( 2 reviews ) Usually go to the location on 50th Street. Never had any problems there. Went to 82nd street last night. Order was incorrect and had to correct. Had to explain 3 times what was incorrect. Got home the food was cold (only a 3 minute drive) Cheese enchildas were tough and one plate has liquid water or grease floating. Even the chips tasted old and were not even warm. I will stick to the 50th street location. September 29, 2010 Doesn't like it Someone needs to be introduced to spices. by BigD ( 5 reviews ) Tortillas are good... the rest is terribly bland. I have no idea why Rosa's is always so packed. I drive by and all I can think is how some people have no taste.
